content.webTitle: Aiyegbeni set to stay at Pompey

fields.headline: Aiyegbeni set to stay at Pompey
fields.bodyText: Yakubu Aiyegbeni has pledged his future to Portsmouth and declared his intentions to lead Harry Redknapp's side into Europe next season. Middlesbrough are believed to be planning a £6m move for Aiyegbeni to replace Massimo Maccarone, but yesterday the player told Boro manager Steve McClaren that he is not interested in a move to the Riverside and that he wants to see out the remaining two years of his Portsmouth contract. "I do not want to think about other offers because I am happy at Portsmouth," said the Nigerian international, who scored 19 goals in all competitions last season. "I have a contract here and we are already looking to next season when I believe getting into Europe is a possibility." Aiyegbeni joined Pompey from Israeli side Maccabi Haifa in a £400,000 deal last summer. The 21-year-old was the hero in the club's Premiership survival, scoring 11 goals in the final 10 games of the season, including four in their 5-1 hammering of Middlesbrough on the final day.
